intro: Uragoga capensis, commonly known as the Cape uragoga, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found along the Atlantic coast. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
